fields_of_interest: Economy, finance and the euro, Trade, Competition, Customs, Energy, Business and Industry, Environment, Single market, Research and innovation, Trans-European Networks, Digital economy and society
eu_initiatives:
Technical Regulations: 
- Machinery Directive (2006/42/EC) 
- Outdoor noise emission (2000/14/EC) 
- Engine emission for Non-Road Mobile Machinery Directive (97/68/EC) 
- Potential future Roading regulation for Non-Road Mobile Machinery (Under study currently by European Commission) 
- Waste Framework Directive, Waste streams (WEEE, RoHS in EEE, Construction and demolition waste, batteries, biodegradable waste, waste oils, etc.)    
- Reach Regulation 
- Electromagnetic Compatibility Directive  
- Radio equipment Directive 
- Directive 2009/104/EC of 16 September 2009 concerning the minimum safety and health requirements for the use of work equipment by workers at work 
 
but also EU legal acts in the field of market surveillance, trade Policy and customs
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
relevant_communication:
Cisma organizes the international exhibition of construction and civil enginnering equipment and technologies. 
Cisma works at national level with different ministrees and at European level with CECE and FEM and also the European institutions.
goals__remit: Represent and promote the industry, to analyse the economic situation ans the markets, to produce statistics, to monitor the French, European and international technical regulation, to take part in the standardization work, to facilitate European and international ccoperation. The association provides information and advice catering for the specifics needs of its member companies on legal, fiscal, environmental and international trade matters.
